title: Which countries have suspended or restricted arms sales to Israel?
content: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.
summary: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.

title: Amid Gaza talks, U.S. releases $1.3 billion in military aid to Egypt
content: The Biden administration had previously withheld some annual funding from Egypt amid scrutiny of its human rights record.
summary: The Biden administration had previously withheld some annual funding from Egypt amid scrutiny of its human rights record.

title: New video, witnesses challenge Israel’s account of U.S. activist’s killing
content: The IDF said Aysenur Eygi was shot “unintentionally” during a “violent riot.” A Post analysis shows clashes had subsided and protesters had retreated.
summary: The IDF said Aysenur Eygi was shot “unintentionally” during a “violent riot.” A Post analysis shows clashes had subsided and protesters had retreated.

title: Biden ‘outraged’ by U.S. activist’s death; Israel kills dozens in Gaza strikes
content: Israel carried out at least four airstrikes in Gaza and mounted raids in two West Bank villages.
summary: Israel carried out at least four airstrikes in Gaza and mounted raids in two West Bank villages.

title: As U.S. and Ukraine debate arms restrictions, Blinken visits Kyiv
content: Kyiv’s attempt to sway the Biden administration comes as Ukraine has faced heavy bombardment from Russia in recent days — especially on its power sector.
summary: Kyiv’s attempt to sway the Biden administration comes as Ukraine has faced heavy bombardment from Russia in recent days — especially on its power sector.

title: Trump debate claims about German energy policy are wrong, says Berlin
content: “We are shutting down — not building — coal and nuclear plants,” Germany’s Foreign Ministry said on social media in response to Trump’s debate comments.
summary: “We are shutting down — not building — coal and nuclear plants,” Germany’s Foreign Ministry said on social media in response to Trump’s debate comments.

title: House GOP maneuvers to portray Democrats as weak on China
content: With its “China Week” blitz of legislation, the House GOP seeks to bolster the party’s foreign policy credentials ahead of November’s election.
summary: With its “China Week” blitz of legislation, the House GOP seeks to bolster the party’s foreign policy credentials ahead of November’s election.

title: Global outlets pick apart debate, with many saying Harris came out on top
content: Reactions to the Trump-Harris debate showed how closely countries are watching for signs of how November’s presidential election could affect their U.S. ties.
summary: Reactions to the Trump-Harris debate showed how closely countries are watching for signs of how November’s presidential election could affect their U.S. ties.

title: Meet Margarita Simonyan, queen of Russia’s covert information wars
content: While the Kremlin has denied U.S. accusations of information operations, Simonyan proudly admits that her work is at the behest of the Russian government.
summary: While the Kremlin has denied U.S. accusations of information operations, Simonyan proudly admits that her work is at the behest of the Russian government.

title: Mexican lawmakers flee protesters, pass contentious judges law
content: The constitutional amendment would give citizens the power to choose nearly all judges. Diplomats, business leaders and legal scholars have expressed alarm.
summary: The constitutional amendment would give citizens the power to choose nearly all judges. Diplomats, business leaders and legal scholars have expressed alarm.

title: How Harris and Trump answered foreign policy questions during the debate
content: Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump debated China ties, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the war in Gaza and the exit from Afghanistan.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump debated China ties, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the war in Gaza and the exit from Afghanistan.

title: Afghan women endure draconian Taliban, 23 years after 9/11
content: The plight of Afghanistan’s women in 2024 provides a grim coda to the saga of the U.S.’s role in the country since 2001. It’s a tale of tragedy and hubris, misadventures and corruption, and — in the final, bleak reckoning — a tale of failure.
summary: The plight of Afghanistan’s women in 2024 provides a grim coda to the saga of the U.S.’s role in the country since 2001. It’s a tale of tragedy and hubris, misadventures and corruption, and — in the final, bleak reckoning — a tale of failure.

title: U.S. demands IDF change West Bank operations after American’s killing
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.

title: Israeli strike kills 19 in Gaza humanitarian area, health officials say
content: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.
summary: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.

title: U.S. accuses Iran of sending ballistic missiles to Russia
content: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.
summary: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.

title: Man accused of setting Olympic runner on fire also dies of burns, hospital says
content: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.
summary: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.

title: Apple, Google must pay billions in back taxes and fines, E.U. court rules
content: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.
summary: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.

title: Dozens dead after Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam
content: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.
summary: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.

title: Ukraine launches largest drone attack yet on Moscow, killing 1, Russia says
content: Russia’s Defense Ministry said at least 140 drones were launched against targets across the country but most were shot down, including 14 in Moscow itself.
summary: Russia’s Defense Ministry said at least 140 drones were launched against targets across the country but most were shot down, including 14 in Moscow itself.

title: Australia plans social media minimum age, citing mental health concerns
content: The government is considering a minimum age of between 14 and 16 for using apps without parental permission, but some experts warn of harmful consequences.
summary: The government is considering a minimum age of between 14 and 16 for using apps without parental permission, but some experts warn of harmful consequences.
